properties.abstract: While the neighbouring Wildhuser Schofberg is very popular among hikers, hardly anybody knows Jöchliturm. Not even swisstopo, the Swiss map maker, knew its name and charted it simply as P. 2335. The summit is only a stone’s throw away from Nädliger with its limestone cliffs full of fossils, which is reachable on one of the most splendid hiking trails of the region. The round trip to Jöchliturm requires some stamina, as the Gamplüt aerial cable way saves only about 200 metres of vertical height. It is important to carry enough water because of the steep, sunny slopes. There are no restaurants on this side of the Alpstein range.
properties.subtitle: Over the "yoke" (Jöchli) instead of under it!
properties.title: Traverse Jöchliturm – Nädliger

sac_photos.title: Nädligergrat, in the background Moor, Jöchliturm and Wildhauser Schafberg.
The karst landscape around Zwinglipass with Zwinglipasshütte
On the Nädliger ridge; the view goes westward to Jöchliturm (centre) and Wildhuser Schofberg (right).
View from Jöchliturm to Nädliger and Altmann
Just before the Zwinglipasshütte, on the left the Altmann.

segments.description: From Wildhaus, Post go to the bottom station of the Gamplüt gondola, then ascend Flüretobel to Teselalp. Continue to Zwinglipass and the cabin via Chreialp.

photos.caption: Shortly before Zwinglipasshütte; on the left is Altmann.

segments.title: Wildhaus – Zwinglipasshütte

segments.description: Traverse below the Altmann south face to reach P. 2334, where the hiking trail leads down on Fliswand to Rotsteinpass.
segments.title: Zwinglipasshütte - P. 2334 (Rotsteinpass)

segments.description: Here the white-blue marked trail on the ridge to Nädliger and Jöchlisattel (P. 2291) begins. On karst and a short ridge without markings you reach Jöchliturm (P. 2335).
segments.title: Rotsteinpass - Nädliger - Jöchliturm

segments.description: Descend back to Jöchlisattel and follow the white-blue markings on the steep face to reach the rock cirque at the foot of Wildhuser Schofberg. A short re-ascent leads to P. 2196 and the huge grassy south face of Schofberg.
segments.title: Jöchliturm - P. 2196 Schofberg south face

segments.description: Follow the now white-red marked mountain hiking trail via Schöferhütte and an escarpment to reach Gamplüt. Now take the gondola or descend to Wildhaus on foot (1/2 h).
segments.title: P. 2196 - Schöferhütte - Gamplüt

segments.description: You can save a good ½ h: shortly before the re-ascent to Wildhuser Schofberg, descend directly to P. 1389 on Teselalp via Wildhuser Schofbode. From there go down Flüretobel to reach Wildhaus within a ½ h.
segments.title: Variant: descent via Wildhuser Schofbode
